semantic_title: Coding Guidelines for Malignant Neoplasm Associated with Transplanted Organ
section_path: Section I > C. Chapter-Specific Coding Guidelines > 2. Chapter 2: Neoplasms > r. Malignant neoplasm associated with transplanted organ

content.full_text: A malignant neoplasm of a transplanted organ should be coded as a transplant complication. Assign first the appropriate code from category T86.-, Complications of transplanted organs and tissue, followed by code C80.2, Malignant neoplasm associated with transplanted organ. Use an additional code for the specific malignancy. (Evidence: pg no: 38, L70-L75)
content.summary: Guidelines for coding malignant neoplasms that develop in transplanted organs as transplant complications (Evidence: pg no: 38, L70-L75)
key_concepts: Malignant neoplasm in transplanted organ is transplant complication (Evidence: pg no: 38, L70-L71)
T86.- code sequenced first (Evidence: pg no: 38, L71-L72)
C80.2 code follows T86.- code (Evidence: pg no: 38, L74-L75)
Additional code for specific malignancy (Evidence: pg no: 38, L75)

detailed_rules.rule_text: A malignant neoplasm of a transplanted organ should be coded as a transplant complication (Evidence: pg no: 38, L70-L71)
detailed_rules.explanation: When malignancy develops in a transplanted organ, it is classified as a complication of the transplant rather than just a primary malignancy (Evidence: pg no: 38, L70-L71)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Assign first the appropriate code from category T86.- (Evidence: pg no: 38, L71-L72)
detailed_rules.explanation: The transplant complication code takes sequencing priority over other codes in this scenario (Evidence: pg no: 38, L71-L72)
common_applications: T86.10 for unspecified kidney transplant complication
T86.40 for unspecified liver transplant complication

detailed_rules.rule_text: Follow T86.- code with C80.2, Malignant neoplasm associated with transplanted organ (Evidence: pg no: 38, L74-L75)
detailed_rules.explanation: C80.2 is specifically required to identify the malignancy as transplant-associated (Evidence: pg no: 38, L74-L75)
common_applications: All cases of malignancy in transplanted organs

detailed_rules.rule_text: Use an additional code for the specific malignancy (Evidence: pg no: 38, L75)
detailed_rules.explanation: The specific type of malignancy must also be coded to provide complete clinical picture (Evidence: pg no: 38, L75)

workflow_steps: Step 1: Identify malignant neoplasm in transplanted organ
Step 2: Assign appropriate T86.- code as principal diagnosis
Step 3: Add C80.2 as secondary diagnosis
Step 4: Add specific malignancy code as additional diagnosis

code_ranges.description: Complications of transplanted organs and tissue (Evidence: pg no: 38, L71-L72)
usage_rules: Always sequenced first (Evidence: pg no: 38, L71-L72)
Followed by C80.2 (Evidence: pg no: 38, L74-L75)

specific_codes.description: Malignant neoplasm associated with transplanted organ (Evidence: pg no: 38, L74-L75)
specific_codes.context: Required for all malignancies in transplanted organs

breakdown.C80: Malignant neoplasm without specification of site

code_patterns.description: Standard pattern for transplant-associated malignancies (Evidence: pg no: 38, L70-L75)
code_patterns.explanation: Transplant complication, then transplant-associated malignancy, then specific malignancy

coding_scenarios.scenario: Patient with kidney transplant develops post-transplant lymphoproliferative disorder
coding_scenarios.documentation_example: Post-transplant lymphoproliferative disorder in kidney transplant recipient, diffuse large B-cell lymphoma
step_by_step: Step 1: Identify malignancy (lymphoma) in transplanted organ context
Step 2: Assign T86.10 (unspecified kidney transplant complication) as principal
Step 3: Add C80.2 (malignant neoplasm associated with transplanted organ)
Step 4: Add C83.30 (diffuse large B-cell lymphoma, unspecified site)

secondary_codes: C80.2 (Malignant neoplasm associated with transplanted organ)
C83.30 (Diffuse large B-cell lymphoma, unspecified site)
correct_coding.sequencing: Transplant complication first, then C80.2, then specific malignancy
correct_coding.rationale: Malignancy in transplanted organ is coded as transplant complication (Evidence: pg no: 38, L70-L75)

incorrect_coding.rationale: Should not sequence specific malignancy first in transplant context
incorrect_coding.common_mistake: Coding as primary malignancy instead of transplant complication

warnings: Always code malignancy in transplanted organ as transplant complication (Evidence: pg no: 38, L70-L71)
best_practices: Use all three code types: T86.-, C80.2, and specific malignancy (Evidence: pg no: 38, L71-L75)
Sequence T86.- code first (Evidence: pg no: 38, L71-L72)
common_mistakes: Coding as primary malignancy instead of transplant complication (Evidence: pg no: 38, L70-L71)
Omitting C80.2 code (Evidence: pg no: 38, L74-L75)
tips: C80.2 is always required for transplant-associated malignancies (Evidence: pg no: 38, L74-L75)
Three-code pattern is standard for these cases (Evidence: pg no: 38, L71-L75)
clinical_context: Applies to post-transplant malignancies related to immunosuppression
